title: The Papers: 'Bad Friday' and 'King backs slavery research'
description: Friday's papers feature travel disruption and King Charles's support for new slavery research.

title: What we can learn from a lonely death in social housing
description: Bureaucracy, isolation and government mistakes all led to a woman lying dead in her London flat for two years.

title: Masters 2023: Scottie Scheffler, Jon Rahm & Brooks Koepka in day one's best shots
description: Watch the best shots from day one of the 2023 Masters, featuring last year's champion Scottie Scheffler and joint leaders Jon Rahm and Brooks Koepka.

title: Formula 1: Red Bull budget cap penalty 'very light', says Ferrari's Frederic Vasseur
description: Ferrari say Red Bull's strong start to the season is partly due to their being given a "very light" punishment for breaking Formula 1's budget cap.

title: England win Women's Finalissima: 'Another box ticked' - Lionesses find a way yet again
description: Conceding a late equaliser and dealing with the pressures of a penalty shootout at Wembley Stadium - this was the test England needed and they passed it.

title: Naples: A city on the brink as Napoli close in on first title in 33 years
description: As Napoli close in on a first Serie A title since the days of Diego Maradona, Neapolitans are feeling proud, passionate and primed to party.

title: Beckton fire: Man arrested on suspicion of murder after woman dies
description: Five people are also known to have been injured in the fire in east London, and taken to hospital.

title: Women's Finalissima: England beat Brazil in dramatic shootout
description: England beat Brazil in a dramatic penalty shootout to win the first Women's Finalissima and extend their unbeaten run to 30 games.

title: Joe Biden administration blames chaotic Afghan pull-out on Trump
description: The review says Mr Biden was "severely constrained", but acknowledges evacuations could have begun sooner.

title: Masters 2023: Jon Rahm & Viktor Hovland lead as Tiger Woods struggles
description: Jon Rahm recovers from a four-putt double bogey on the first hole to share the early clubhouse lead on a scoreable opening day at the Masters.

title: Wales 4-1 Northern Ireland: Jess Fishlock stars as hosts win comfortably
description: Jess Fishlock stars as Wales breezed past Northern Ireland 4-1 in a friendly at the Cardiff City Stadium.

title: Cardiff flat owner gets tax bills for 11,000 Chinese firms
description: Dylan Davies's hundreds of VAT bills for companies he had never heard of totalled £500,000.

title: Israel blames Hamas for Lebanon rocket barrage as tensions rise
description: The attack, which saw 34 rockets fired into northern Israel, comes at a time of rising tension.

title: MP Scott Benton claims ways around hospitality rules
description: The MP was suspended by the Tories after being filmed offering to lobby ministers for a fake company.

title: Jimmy White's bid for World Championship return ends in second round of qualifying
description: Jimmy White's bid to return to the World Championship ends in the second round of qualifying as he loses to Martin O'Donnell at the English Institute of Sport in Sheffield.

title: Ofsted grades unfit for purpose, says ex-inspector
description: Dr Martin Hanbury quit the role after Ruth Perry took her own life ahead of a report on her school.

title: Lucy Letby trial: Nurse moved to risk office after baby deaths, jury told
description: Lucy Letby was given a role in patient safety after doctors raised concerns about her, a court hears.

title: Easter travel: Millions set for getaway with delays likely
description: Some hold ups on the roads are expected, as fine and settled weather is forecast across the UK.

title: Give me more power to sack officers - Met chief
description: Sir Mark Rowley says he wants to drive rogue officers out after a series of high profile scandals.

title: US President Joe Biden expected to visit only one NI venue
description: An invitation to address the Stormont assembly has also been turned down, BBC News NI understands.

title: France protests: La Rotonde bistro liked by Macron attacked
description: Riot police defend La Rotonde brasserie in Paris, on the 11th day of unrest over pension reform.

title: No action after probe into Tory Islamophobia claim
description: Former chief whip Mark Spencer was investigated by the PM's ethics adviser over claims by MP Nus Ghani.

title: Man murdered pregnant wife by pushing her off Arthur's Seat
description: Kashif Anwar killed 31-year-old Fawziyah Javed by pushing her from Arthur's Seat in September 2021.

title: Frank Lampard: New Chelsea interim manager says 'this is my club' after returning to Blues
description: Frank Lampard says he will "do his utmost" to satisfy fans after being appointed interim Chelsea manager just over two years after he was sacked by the club.

title: Katelan Coates: Extensive searches for missing Todmorden 14-year-old
description: Katelan Coates, from Todmorden, was last seen getting off a bus in Burnley on 28 March.

title: Covid jabs for under fives in at-risk groups
description: Jabs will start to be offered from mid-June, after government vaccine experts made recommendation.

title: Sheffield: Murder arrest of boy, 12, after woman hit by car
description: Police say the woman in her 60s died in the Greenhill area of Sheffield on Wednesday night.

title: CBI lobby group in 'difficult place' after rape claim, says member
description: Andy Wood, boss of brewer Adnams, says his company is considering its membership of the group.

title: Amazon takeover of iRobot faces UK watchdog probe
description: A review has begun into the tech giant's planned takeover of the makers of Roomba vacuum cleaners.

title: Wirral park attack: Man who raped Ukrainian refugee jailed
description: Jwamer Saygul violently attacked the woman when she rejected his advances in a park, prosecutors say.

title: Betting limits for under-25s expected in new laws, reports say
description: The government is reportedly looking at limiting the amount punters can bet on online slot games.

title: Frank Lampard: Chelsea name ex-manager as boss until end of season
description: Frank Lampard is appointed Chelsea manager until the end of the season - just over two years after he was sacked by the club.

title: Ex-Italy PM Silvio Berlusconi in intensive care
description: Colleagues express hopes that he will return to politics amid reports that he has leukaemia.

title: The moment lightning strikes the tip of Toronto's CN Tower
description: Lightning struck the famous tower early on Wednesday morning.

title: King Charles and Queen Consort take part in first Easter coins ceremony
description: King Charles and the Queen Consort handed out specially minted coins in York during a traditional service.

title: Russian girl who drew anti-war image handed to mother
description: The Russian girl was taken away from her father after her school reported the picture to the authorities.

title: King Charles supports study into royal family slavery links
description: A new study will explore the relationship between the monarchy and the transatlantic slave trade.

title: Elle Edwards: Man denies Christmas Eve pub murder
description: Connor Chapman pleads not guilty to the murder of Elle Edwards outside a pub in Wallasey.

title: Human bones find turns out to be toy pirate skeleton with parrot
description: Police say a "brave officer" got close enough to find it was a model of Captain Hook and his parrot.

title: DP World Tour: LIV Golf players told to pay £100,000 over 'serious breaches'
description: The DP World Tour wins its arbitration case against 12 LIV Golf players after an arbitration panel ruled in its favour.

title: Michael Gove admits mistakes over social housing after tenant death
description: The housing secretary says regulatory changes and a "culture of neglect" meant tenants were let down.

title: Fernando Alonso: How the Spaniard helped Aston Martin leap on to the podium places
description: Fernando Alonso's contribution to Aston Martin's leap to the podium should not be underestimated, says team principal Mike Krack.

title: Star Wars: Oscar-winning production designer Norman Reynolds dies
description: Reynolds worked on the Star Wars and Indiana Jones film series and created many iconic scenes.

title: Michael K Williams: Drug dealer pleads guilty over The Wire actor's death
description: A man sold the fentanyl-laced heroin in New York which killed The Wire actor, US court hears.

title: Macron counting on Xi to 'bring Russia to senses'
description: The French leader, on a visit to China, is hoping Mr Xi can influence Russia to end its war in Ukraine.

title: New tax year: Threshold risk for millions as benefits rise
description: Frozen thresholds add to the personal income tax burden but the state pension and benefits will rise within days.

title: NI licensing laws: No more supermarket points for alcohol sales
description: Alcohol sellers in Northern Ireland can no longer run some loyalty schemes, under new laws.

title: Nicola Sturgeon pulls out of event as police search continues
description: The former Scottish first minister's decision comes the day after her husband was questioned by police.

title: Nina Hughes: Meet the 41-year-old who became boxing world champion in just five fights
description: Nina Hughes' rise to the top has been supercharged, but there were years of rejection and self-doubt before she became world champion.

title: Lionel Messi: Where will Argentina legend be playing next season?
description: There are a number of places where Lionel Messi could be playing football next season, writes Spanish football expert Guillem Balague.

title: Robert F Kennedy Jr to challenge Biden for White House
description: JFK's nephew said his top priority would be to "end the corrupt merger between state and corporate power".

title: Rivals Iran and Saudi Arabia hold high-level talks
description: The foreign ministers from the two bitter Middle Eastern rivals meet for the first time since 2016.

title: 'My rented home is mouldy but I can't afford to move'
description: Renters in Blackpool tell the BBC they're struggling while living in flats which have poor energy efficiency ratings.

title: World Snooker Championship: Stephen Hendry loses to James Cahill in qualifying
description: Stephen Hendry's bid to reach the World Championship for the first time since 2012 ends in the first round of qualifying.

title: Deborah James's daughter: Always have rebellious hope
description: The family of Dame Deborah James pay tribute to her after a fund started by her reaches £11.3m.

title: Sepsis: Woman, 24, dies weeks after getting flu symptoms
description: Bethannie Booth's family want others to be aware of the symptoms of the deadly infection.

title: Women's Finalissima: England face Brazil at sold-out Wembley in historic first
description: The champions of Europe and South America - England and Brazil - will face off in a one-off match at Wembley this week in a first for women's football.

title: Barriers fitted at last level crossing of its kind in Scotland
description: The crossing in Aviemore is on a line used by Strathspey Railway's steam locomotives.

title: Love for Dame Deborah James breathtaking, says husband
description: The late campaigner's family vow to do all they can to prevent cancer deaths, as fund raises £11.3m.

title: UK’s first women-only residential treatment for gamblers offers hope
description: The BBC has been given exclusive access to the UK's first female-only residential gambling treatment centre.

title: Lib Dems call for legal duty for police to attend burglaries
description: The party says a "postcode lottery" means police in some areas attend less than half of burglaries.

title: Time set for national mobile phone emergency warning test
description: The government says a national emergency warning test will avoid disrupting major sporting events.

title: Pentonville Prison: Ex-inmate explains impact of overcrowding
description: A former Pentonville inmate explains what life is like at the jail, where the population is soaring.

title: Platypus taken on train sparks Australia police hunt
description: Police urge two people seen on a train with the wild creature, which has venomous spurs, to hand it in.

title: Local elections: What you need to vote is changing in England
description: The BBC's Ione Wells explains, in a minute, the new rules in England ahead of local elections on 4 May.

title: Patients at risk during doctor strike - NHS bosses
description: The British Medical Association is refusing to provide any exemptions for life and limb cover next week.

title: Home Office pauses removal of Kabul embassy Gurkhas
description: The group of Nepalese men have been in the UK since the Taliban takeover of Afghanistan.

title: Olaparib: Drug to treat inherited cancers offered on NHS in England and Wales
description: Olaparib specifically targets cancers caused by faulty genes, like BRCA, and could be life-saving.
